pr_title: Lettuce 5.1 instrumentation should log normalised commands as db.statement

timeline.message: Lettuce 5.1 instrumentation should log normalised commands as db.statement

timeline.body: This class can be reused by other Redis libraries' instrumentations; I'll move it to some common package (`javaagent-api`?) in next PR and call it whenever args are available. Currently lettuce 5.1 is the only Redis lib instrumentation that logs actual statement, not just the bare command.
timeline.bodyText: This class can be reused by other Redis libraries' instrumentations; I'll move it to some common package (javaagent-api?) in next PR and call it whenever args are available. Currently lettuce 5.1 is the only Redis lib instrumentation that logs actual statement, not just the bare command.

timeline.bodyHTML:
I'm not sure the wrappedKey named grouping helps readability here

Suggested change
int wrapperStart = m.start("wrappedKey");
newArgs.append(args, end, wrapperStart).append(m.group("key"));
end = m.end("wrappedKey");
int start = m.start();
newArgs.append(args, lastEnd, start).append(m.group("key"));
lastEnd = m.end();
timeline.author: trask

timeline.body: instead of appending and then splitting, does it help if we build the list directly as we iterate above?

timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyHTML:
took me a while to understand the parity matching, I think something like this would be easier to read

Suggested change
// whether keys are on even or odd index depends on the number of initial args
int keys = numOfArgsBeforeKeyValue % 2;
for (; i < args.size(); ++i) {
normalised
.append(" ")
// append only keys, skip values
.append(i % 2 == keys ? args.get(i) : "?");
}
// loop over keys only
for (i = numOfArgsBeforeKeyValue; i < args.size(); i += 2) {
normalised
.append(" ")
.append(args.get(i))
.append(" ?");
}
timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyHTML:
I think this is easier to read, but curious other thoughts, I also see attractiveness of current approach which increments a single counter to show that everything is hit

Suggested change
int i = 0;
for (; i < numOfArgsToKeep && i < args.size(); ++i) {
normalised.append(" ").append(args.get(i));
}
for (; i < args.size(); ++i) {
for (int i = 0; i < numOfArgsToKeep && i < args.size(); ++i) {
normalised.append(" ").append(args.get(i));
}
for (int i = numOfArgsToKeep; i < args.size(); ++i) {

Lettuce 5.1 instrumentation should log normalised commands as db.statement

timeline.bodyHTML:
sorry, i didn't explain my thought about this well, this is more what i was thinking, keeping the previous KEY_PATTERN:

please pick whichever implementation you want (original, current, or below), i don't see a clear winner myself

Suggested change
while (m.find()) {
String wrapped = m.group("wrapped");
if (wrapped != null) {
argsList.add(wrapped);
} else {
argsList.add(m.group("plain"));
}
}
int lastEnd = 0;
while (m.find()) {
int wrapperStart = m.start();
argsList.addAll(split(args, lastEnd, wrapperStart));
argsList.add(m.group("key"));
lastEnd = m.end();
}
argsList.addAll(split(args, lastEnd, args.length()));
...
private static final Pattern SPLIT_PATTERN = Pattern.compile(" ");
private static List<String> split(String args, int from, int to) {
return Arrays.asList(SPLIT_PATTERN.split(args.subSequence(from, to)));
}
timeline.author: trask

replies.bodyText: Oh, I see. Hmm, I think I'll leave it as it is now - the pattern is a bit more complex but I like the fact that we only go through the entire string once.
replies.author: mateuszrzeszutek
